item.title: Sotheby’s Lands a Leonard Lauder Art Collection Worth More Than $400 Million
item.description: The collector’s trove of 55 works, including Klimt, Matisse and Munch, will be auctioned in November.

item.title: Washington Post Columnist Says She Was Fired for Posts After Charlie Kirk Shooting
item.description: Karen Attiah said she was fired for “speaking out against political violence” and America’s apathy toward guns.

item.title: Eddie Giacomin, Rangers’ Goalie and Fan Favorite, Dies at 86
item.description: A Hall of Famer, he led the N.H.L. in shutouts and single-season victories three times and was stunned when the Rangers let him go in his 10th season.

item.title: Cuomo, Staunch Supporter of Israel, Says ‘Horrific’ Gaza War Must End
item.description: The remarks were a departure for former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who trails Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani in the New York City mayor’s race.

item.title: Football Is Coming to Saudi Arabia, Where Soccer Is King
item.description: Saudi Arabia will host a flag football tournament featuring N.F.L. stars in the spring, in a mutually beneficial sports expansion.
